title: Excel HCR - A Date Occurring

metadata.description: Learn about Excel HCR - A Date Occurring with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Highlight Cell Rules - A Date Occurring
Highlight Cell Rules is a premade type of conditional formatting in Excel used to change the appearance of cells in a range based on your specified
conditions
.
A Date Occurring...
is one of the options for the condition.
Here is the Highlight Cell Rules part of the conditional formatting menu:
Highlight Cell Rule - A Date Occurring Example
The "A Date Occurring..." Highlight Cell Rule will highlight a cell with one of the appearance options based on the cell value relative to a specified time frame.
The time frame can be:
Yesterday
Today
Tomorrow
In the last 7 days
Last Week
This Week

Last Month
This Month

In this example, the specified time frame will be "
Name	Type 1	Birthday	Year
      Bulbasaur	Grass	27-Feb	1996
      Charmander	Fire	27-Feb	1996
      Squirtle	Water	27-Feb	1996
      Chikorita	Grass	21-Nov	1999
      Cyndaquil	Fire	21-Nov	1999
      Totodile	Water	21-Nov	1999
      Treecko	Grass	21-Nov	2002
      Torchic	Fire	21-Nov	2002
      Mudkip	Water	21-Nov	2002
      Turtwig	Grass	28-Sep	2006
      Chimchar	Fire	28-Sep	2006
      Piplup	Water	28-Sep	2006
      Snivy	Grass	18-Sep	2010
      Tepig	Fire	18-Sep	2010
      Oshawott	Water	18-Sep	2010
      Chespin	Grass	12-Oct	2013
      Fennekin	Fire	12-Oct	2013
      Froakie	Water	12-Oct	2013
Copy Values
You can
choose any range
for where the Highlight Cell Rule should apply. It can be a few cells, a single column, a single row, or a combination of multiple cells, rows and columns.
Let's apply the rule to the Birthday values.
"A Date Occurring..." Highlight Cell Rule, step by step:
Select the range
C2:C19
for the Birthday values
Click on the Conditional Formatting icon
in the ribbon, from
Home
menu
Select
Highlight Cell Rules
from the drop-down menu
Select
A Date Occurring...
from the menu
This will open a dialog box where you can specify the value and the appearance option.
Select "
Select the appearance option "Yellow Fill with Dark Yellow Text" from the dropdown menu
Now, the cells with values A Date Occurring 
Note:
In this example, the 
September
.
Turtwig, Chimchar, Piplup, Snivy, Tepig, and Oshawott all have birthdays in September, so their cells are highlighted.
Note:
You can remove the Highlight Cell Rules with
Manage Rules
.

★
+1

quiz.question:
What is A Date Occurring
Highlight Cell Rules?
options:
Not a A Date Occurring
Highlight Cell Rules.

a premade type of conditional formatting in Excel used to change the appearance of cells in a range based on your specified
conditions
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of A Date Occurring
Highlight Cell Rules is 'a premade type of conditional formatting in Excel used to change the appearance of cells in a range based on your specified
conditions'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers Excel HCR - A Date Occurring concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Excel HCR - A Date Occurring effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Excel HCR - A Date Occurring and how to apply it in your projects.
